climbs.name: Team International
climbs.fa: FA: B. Sheier, B. Bucek, O.  Kittelsen 1996; FFA. C. Frisbie, B. Sheier 1997.

content.description: Powerful face climbing and stemming through 4 bolts in a shallow white dihedral spits you out below a stellar 1" splitter on an overhanging head wall. Rest up on the jugs in the bright red band of rock before committing to the pumpy crack. Extend your gear and traverse left about 10 feet along a jug lined ledge and follow a moderate hand crack up 15 more feet to the anchors.
content.location: Continue past Diet Pepsi and Ophidiphobia heading south for about 30 yards. Locate four bolts in the shallow dihedral and the crack splitting the upper head wall about 30' up.Â

content.description: Starts with face climbing to gain the flaring wide crack cutting through the roof. This crack has a tendency to be wet, so catch it during the dry summer months.
content.protection: 5 bolts, rap anchor; blue metolius, #2 & #4 camalot to reduce run-outs.
content.location: This route is 30 ft left of Head Lice, on the left side of the Ultimate Frisbie roof.

content.description: Climb the handcrack on the left side of the bowl 30 feet to the roof crack.  Turn the roof via the crack on the left side.  You can belay above, but it's better to place long slings and continue to the top.  Continue following the crack system above over a few bulges and to the top of the cliff.  Good rock for the first 30 feet, great rock after.
content.protection: Gear to 3.5".  Many slings to help rope drag.  Rap off trees or hike over to Diet Pepsi and rap off bolts.
content.location: Near the right end of the Dark Side Wall, this is the 8 foot triangular roof about 30 feet off the ground.  Start in the crack below it.

climbs.name: Ophidiphobia
climbs.fa: Mike Downing, Scott Hall, Sandy Fleming  1985

content.description: Climb the starting hand/fistcrack of Diet Pepsi.  At the ledge, traverse right to the angling rail which leads under the roof.  Climb the handcrack in the roof back to the left, pulling over on jams and holds to a welcome ledge.  Climb the face with tricky gear and a few tricky moves to the bolts on Diet Pepsi.
content.protection: Gear to 4", doubles of 1,2,3,4 camalots helpful.  Shares bolted anchor with Diet Pepsi.
content.location: Just right of Diet Pepsi.  In fact, they share the same start and anchors.

content.description: The best start is the fistcrack on the right.  Climb up it, being careful of brittle rock.  Make your way up and left to the roof crack.  Jam your way over the roof and continue to the top in the crack.  Good rock at the roof and above.
content.protection: Pro to 4".  Rap off trees, or take a short hike over to Diet Pepsi and rap off bolts.
content.location: Near the right end of the Dark Side Wall, this climb is in the deep corner between Diet Pepsi and Razorback Roof.  Start in either crack system below the roof crack at the back of the corner.

content.description: A fine delicacy. I felt like I was climbing up the underside of a large, delicate mushroom on the vertical section.  Once you reach the monster roof and look out though, this mushroom turns into a snarling flesh consuming man-eater. Gnarly sequences lead through the flaring  exit into a bombay squeeze chimney. Think "one-move-wonder-boulder-problem-chimney-thrash".
content.protection: I used-   BDC's: .5, #3, #4.5, #2.   + draws(4 bolts), slings, rap anchor(one spinner on the anchor)
content.location: Starts on a delicate, soft face beneath the flaring offwidth 40 feet above(like each of the routes next to it). Pull onto the face via a cool roof boulder problem and stem your way through the choss and imagine being an ant climbing up the underside of a mushroom. The roof is protected with bolts.  This line is the third right of the amphitheater.

content.description: Climb the slightly steeper than vertical handcrack 15 feet to the ledge.  From here, climb the offwidth dihedral as it widens slightly as you get higher.  Pull around the right side of the triangular roof, continuing in the crack past a small tree.  Go around the left side of the tree, if you aren't too sketched, to reduce rope drag.  5 more feet of face climbing gets you to the anchors.  Awesome rock, awesome climb!
content.protection: Pro to the big stuff.  2 bolt anchor, accessed from the top.  Rap or lower.
content.location: Near the right end of the Dark Side Wall is a large dihedral with a 4-5" offwidth.  Start in the handcrack under the right side of the ledge.

climbs.name: The Couch Potato
climbs.fa: Sandy Fleming, Lezley McIlveen, Scott Hall  1985

content.description: Climb 20 feet up a dirty slab, starting left of the groove.  Angle right and gain the diagonal crack.  Follow it up and righ until it ends after about 30 feet.  Then, continue up on face climbing, pulling a spicy top out on decent rock.  The rock in between the slab and the top out is excellent.
content.protection: Pro to 3".  Rap off trees, or hike to a top accessed bolted anchor.
content.location: This route starts right of the huge roof at the left end of the Dark Side Wall.  Start on a slab that heads up to a left angling crack running through a roof.  Notice the right angling diagonal hand crack starting 20 feet up.  Take it and enjoy the ride.

content.description: Climb the thin crack up to the dihedral on pretty good rock. Pull through the dihedral, then head up and right to gain the dihedral crack that widens into the roof. At the roof chimney, squeeze behind the first chockstone. It may wiggle a little. End on the clifftop above. Good rock, overall, but catch it when it's dry.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5". Move over to Guitars on Stun to rap. Also, maybe the lines on the huge roof to the right have top accessed bolted anchors?
content.location: Just right of the large overhang that has 3 or 4 offwidths going through the roof.  This line ends up going through the large chimney roof with two large chockstones in it. Start in the thin crack below the chimney.

content.description: This overhanging dihedral has plenty of feet, openings, and positive crimps to keep the climbing interesting and engaging while still a moderate 10a. Climb the wide crack through a large horizontal break. crimp up to the large opening that accepts a #5, then climb above your gear from opening to opening. When the dihedral returns to vertical, mantle onto a small ledge, and finish the climb on blocky lie-backs to the anchors out right.
content.location: The dihedral climber's right of The Couch Potato. More enjoyable than it looks!

content.description: Climb the slab, angling a little right, to access the crack. Pull up into the crack, over a bulge, and to the top on more vertical rock. Good rock. Had a little lichen and many spiderwebs when I did it.
content.protection: Pro to 3.5". New guide shows 2 bolt anchor at top.
content.location: Near the left end of the Arachnophobia Wall, this is the left facing dihedral fist crack. Starts on the slab below the bottom of the crack.

content.description: A wide variety of climbing on good rock.
